item.title: Hotfix 6.0.2 scheduled for Friday 20th December
item.description:
Hey folks,

Our QA teams are currently hard at work doing their final testing for Hotfix 6.0.2, and it’s our aim to publish this update this Friday, 20th December, so that we can get these changes out to you before we power down for the Holidays. This hotfix brings with it a number of adjustments following on from last week's Update 6.0, including fixes to Ogre Camp and Vampire Count stances, some improvements to one of Golgfag’s victory conditions and much more, as well as fixes for those known issues originally detailed in our message last week.

Whilst we’re completing all our own final checks, if you’re a Steam user we’ve given you the opportunity to download this hotfix right now as an opt-in Beta branch, allowing you to take an early look at what we’re changing, and press on with your campaigns. Instructions on how to do this can be found at the bottom of this post.

If all goes well, we’ll release this Hotfix to all players on Friday, and anyone who opts into the Beta will be able to continue with any campaign progress they make in the meantime. If we need to change up our plans, we’ll be loud across all our community channels with revised timing for the update.

Let’s dive straight into what’s included!


Hotfix 6.0.2 Release Notes

HIGHLIGHTS
​
  • Fixed a bug where, if the Ogre Camp ranks up, its stance reverts to Raiding stance.
  • Fixed a bug where, if an Ogre Camp recruits units from within itself, it drops out of Encamp stance and switches to Raiding stance.
  • Fixed an issue where Vampire Counts were missing the ambush stance.
  • Added Lightning Strike to Skarsnik's 'Ready & Waitin'' skill.
  • Slightly adjusted Golgfag's victory conditions – gifts to clients now count as occupied settlements (see the dev note in the Victory Conditions section below).
PERFORMANCE
  • Fixed a soft lock that occurred after Valkia retreated from the Spear of Slaupnir battle mission.
CAMPAIGN
GENERAL/GAMEPLAY
  • Added a camp limit check for Ogre camps.
  • Decreased the amount of Treasury and Meat gained from Golgfag's Contracts to align with the intended design.
  • Fixed an issue where Arbaal could receive the defeat dilemma after losing a Lightning Strike battle as a reinforcing army (i.e., not actively participating in the battle).
  • Increased the amount of Planz gained from battles as Gorbad (1 → 2).
  • Fixed an issue where Arbaal could sometimes receive more than eight Challenges of Khorne simultaneously.
  • Fixed an issue where advice about a Chaos God becoming ascendant in the Great Game would play for factions without Unholy Manifestations.
  • Fixed an issue where Blood Host armies that were reinforcing would not have their attrition immunity timers updated after winning a battle.
  • Fixed a bug where the 'Travel to Client' teleport for Golgfag was unavailable when any lord or settlement from the player faction was involved in a siege (either on attack or defence).
STANCES
  • Fixed a bug where the High Elves' Alith Anar's Stalking stance did not display the correct icon.
  • Fixed a bug where Vampire Coast Lords were unable to enter Dig stance to uncover treasure.
  • Fixed an issue where Vampire Counts were missing the ambush stance.
  • Fixed a bug where, if the Ogre Camp ranks up, its stance reverts to Raiding stance.
  • Fixed a bug where, if an Ogre Camp recruits units from within itself, it drops out of Encamp stance and switches to Raiding stance.
  • Fixed an issue where loaned armies had no available stances.
TECHNOLOGY TREE
  • Fixed an issue where the Khorne technology 'Giant Slayer' was not applying to Khorngor units.
  • Fixed the Khorne technology 'Rage Within' – it no longer incorrectly targets non-infantry units.
ABILITIES/ATTRIBUTES/TRAITS
  • Fixed several issues where abilities and attributes were not functioning for the following Golgfag banners: Bomb Lobber, Bone Muncha, Feral, and Slayer.
  • Fixed an issue where Scyla Anfingrimm would not have his innate trait when playing as Daemons of Chaos.
SKILL TREE
  • Added Lightning Strike to Skarsnik's 'Ready & Waitin'' skill.
RECRUITMENT
  • Fixed an issue where Slaughtermasters and Butchers were not receiving Skrag's recruit rank bonus when recruited from Camps.
  • Reduced Mangler Squig recruitment time from 2 turns to 1.
VICTORY CONDITIONS
  • Slightly adjusted Golgfag's victory conditions – gifts to clients now count as occupied settlements.

    ​Dev Note: Golgfag relies on gifting settlements rather than occupying, sacking, or razing, so we now count gifted settlements towards that total.
UI/UX
  • Fixed a bug where the Ogre Camps scripted tour text said 'sent' instead of 'send'.
BATTLE
GENERAL/GAMEPLAY
  • Fixed an issue where fighting in the new regions added to southern Cathay could result in a blank battle map.
  • Fixed an issue preventing the Pit of Shades from targeting the ground correctly.
  • Fixed a bug where certain units, including Oxyotl and Gyrobombers, could turn and fire multiple volleys at once.
  • The Unstoppable Choppas ability now does +50% weapon strength up from 25%.
MODELS/ANIMATIONS
  • Fixed a bug where Arbaal on Fleshound bent too far forward during a rider defend animation.
  • Fixed an issue in Skulltaker's quest battle where the enemy Dwarf Runelord's model appeared corrupted.
UI/UX
  • Fixed an issue with the artillery manual aiming mode using ALT + Right-click.
POST-BATTLE
  • Increased the Meat cap from post-battle captives from 62 to 250.
  • Fixed an issue where, at times, the number of Mangler Squigs that survived a battle differed from the number of units alive in the post-battle.


How to download the Beta branch

If you’re a Steam user and would like to get a preview of this hotfix today, you can opt-in to the Beta branch right now. Here’s how to do it:
  1. Open your Steam client and go to your Library.
  2. Right-click on Total War: WARHAMMER III and select 'Properties'.


  3. Navigate to the 'Betas' tab.


  4. In the drop-down menu, select the option ‘beta_hotfix – BETA Hotfix 6.0.2'.


  5. Steam will then download the necessary files and begin the patching process to install the Hotfix.
The download is relatively small, but Steam will need to patch around 30GB of game data in order to install the Hotfix. This can take some time depending on your hard drive speeds.

The full release of Hotfix 6.0.2 is currently aiming for this Friday, and when this happens your game will automatically switch to the main release.

Please note: If you update to 6.0.2 early, you will only be able to play multiplayer with other players who are also opted in to the 6.0.2 Beta until the update rolls out to all players. You can switch back to 6.0.1 at any time by selecting ‘None’ in the Betas dropdown menu.


Thanks once again for your ongoing feedback. As always, if you run into any issues after updating to Hotfix 6.0.2, please let us know in our dedicated bug reporting sub-forum.

If we're looking good this Friday, check back on this post for any ammendments we might have made in the event we roll out the Hotfix for all players.

See you on the battlefield!

— The Total War Team

⚠ IMPORTANT

If you experience any issues after downloading the update, please take a moment to Verify the integrity of the game files first to ensure there were no issues when downloading. A step-by-step guide can be found in this article.

If the issues persist, please visit our support site for additional troubleshooting steps and assistance.

🧱 MOD WARNING

Please note that user-generated mods may have compatibility issues with new game updates. If you are encountering performance or stability issues following a release, is recommended that you disable any mods you're running. If you continue to experience issues, please visit our support site for additional troubleshooting steps and assistance.

item.title: ⚙️ Hotfix ⚙️
item.description:
OI, SPEEK FREEKS!

We're just dropped a hotfix for various things below, including some stuff for Alternate Weapons which will be playable again this weekend. Be sure to jump in for some new kinds of krumpin'!

  • Fixed issue with player progression needing a client restart to be shown properly in the menu
  • Fixed issue with Steam Deck / Linux players no longer being able to play because of Easy Anti-Cheat being a right git. If you still get kicked to the menu and see an error pop up, just matchmake again and things should work fine after that.
  • Reverted change to status bar text on HUD using red outline which apparently made some players' eyes bleed
  • Fixed issue with Kustom Boosta-Blasta and Megatrakk Scrapjet getting speed loss
  • Fixed bots using alt weapons that weren't synced properly.
  • Fixed performance issue with the kill kam where it was tanking framerate when loading
  • Fixed/updated game mode text for Deff Rally to reflect racing changes made in last patch
  • Reduced size of central game mode HUD element to reduce clutter. More room ta see da krumpin'!
  • Updated Looted Wagon crosshair so it reflects cooldown of the Kannon. This is a test to see how players like it (you will). If they do, we'll apply the same system to other vehicles
  • Grot bomm now has a big flare on it so it's easier to see coming and increased sound distance. Reduced it's max duration from 13 sec to 10, which also fixed a bug with VFX disappearing
  • Kustom Boosta-Blasta alternate weapon fire rate set to 0.6 (from 1.2), damage set to 33 (from 22), splash radius set to 12 (from 10). This weapon will be playable this coming weekend!
  • Updated popup message text when getting kicked to the menu because of Easy Anti-Cheat issues
  • Made the Grot Mega Tank rokkit knockback consistently pop enemies up instead of randomly spin them out
  • Returns Shokkjump Dragsta lock on crosshair

item.title: The Turkish language comes to Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
item.description:
Lord Kaptanlar!

Gününüzü heyecan verici bir haberle şenlendirmek isteriz: Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, Türkçe oluyor! Türk oyuncularımız, bugünden itibaren ana dillerinde metin ve alt yazılarla oyuna dalabilecekler.

Menü, alt yazı ve oyun içi metinlerle beraber tam bir Türkçe dil desteği sunmaktan gurur duyuyoruz. Bu yerelleştirme seçenekleri oyuna pürüzsüzce entegre edilmiştir. Desteklenen diller arasında geçiş yapmak için ayarlar menüsüne girmeniz yeterlidir. Bu güncellemenin Türkçe konuşan oyuncularımıza Warhammer 40.000: Rogue Trader'ı daha erişilebilir kılacağını ve muhteşem bir oyun deneyimi sunacağını umuyoruz.

Türkçe yerelleştirmenin şimdilik sadece ana oyun için mevcut olduğunu lütfen unutmayın. Void Shadow DLC metin çevirileri eksiktir ve bu metinler şu an İngilizcedir. DLC yerelleştirmesi sonraki bir güncelleme ile eklenecektir.

Daimî desteklerinden dolayı topluluğumuza teşekkür etmek istiyoruz ve bu haberi Türkçe konuşan oyuncularımıza sunmaktan büyük heyecan duyuyoruz. Koronus Enginliği'ni ana dilinizle ilk kez keşfe çıkmaya hazır olun!

Mürettebatınızı hazır edin Lord Kaptan! Macera sizi bekliyor.

__________

Lord Captains!

We would like to brighten your day with some exciting news: the Turkish language is coming to Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader! Starting today, our Turkish players will be able to immerse themselves in the game with text and subtitles in their native language.

We are proud to introduce full Turkish language support, including menus, subtitles, and in-game texts. These localization options are seamlessly integrated into the game; to switch between supported languages, simply go to the settings menu. We hope that this update will make Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader more accessible and provide our Turkish-speaking players with an outstanding gaming experience.

Please note that for now, the Turkish localization is available only for the base game. The Void Shadow DLC texts are missing translations and are currently written in English. The DLC localization will be added later.

We'd like to thank our community for their ongoing support, and we're excited to bring this news to our Turkish-speaking players. Prepare to explore the Koronus Expanse in your native tongue like never before!

Ready your crew, Lord Captain! The journey awaits.
